title: Creating Snowplow Accelerators
content:
Introduction Welcome to the Snowplow Accelerators accelerator. Accelerators empower users to efficiently gain value from Snowplowâ€™s technology. This guide covers how to make use of the accelerators template and some general style guidance.
Who is this guide for? Snowplow employees looking to get started with Accelerators What you will learn Generate a hugo site What content to include/exclude

title: Folder Structure
content:
Hugo Site Generation Hugo is website generator used to build accelerators. This allows us to quickly generate a site, with custom theming and integration with Github pages.
Most of the Hugo code sits in the accelerator-web-ui-template repo, but for the site to get generated a few things are needed.
Content: This folder contains all of the markdown files that make up the content of the site Workflows: This folder contains the github action with site specific configuration Content Folder The content folder defines the structure of the site. Each folder makes up a chapter which then generates a navbar as below:
Chapters For every chapter, an _index.md file is required. This is the entry point for the chapter and also contains metadata such as the title and position the chapter takes. This is specified at the top of the page, the metadata for the Hugo Chapter page is as below:
+++ title="Hugo" chapter = true weight = 2 pre = "" post = "" +++ A short description of the chapter can then be added in markdown.
Content The content is also stored in markdown files within the content folder and can be named anything.
These pages also have metadata stored in them defining the page title and order they’re to be displayed in. For example this page has the markdown below.
+++ title = "Setup" weight = 1 +++

title: Markdown Syntax
content:
Headers ## Chapter Header ### Page Header #### Subheader renders to:
Chapter Header Page Header Subheader Formats **Bold** renders to Bold *Italic* renders to Italic ~Strikethrough~ renders to ~Strikethrough~ > Blockquote. renders to >Blockquote `inline code` renders to inline code

title: Notice
content:
There are 4 types of notice add structure to your page.
Note {{% notice note %}} This is a note {{% /notice %}} renders as
This is a note
Info {{% notice info %}} An information notice {{% /notice %}} renders as
An information notice
Tip {{% notice tip %}} A tip notice {{% /notice %}} renders as
A tip notice
Warning {{% notice warning %}} A warning notice {{% /notice %}} renders as
A warning notice

title: Local Testing
content:
To test the site locally you will need to install Hugo via brew:
brew install hugo The github action will deploy the site with the theme included, however to test locally you will need to add the below files to your project.
Attachments Theme.zip (22 MB) To view the hugo site run:
hugo serve The site should be available at localhost:1313/{ACCELERATOR_NAME}

title: Mermaid
content:
Mermaid is a library that generates charts and diagrams in markdown.
Gantt Chart Gantt charts are used to demonstrate how long an accelerator will take.
{{<mermaid>}} gantt dateFormat HH-mm axisFormat %M section 1. Step 1 1h :step1, 00-00, 1m section 2. Step 2 2h :step2, after step1, 2m section 3. Step 3 3h :step3, after step2, 3m {{</mermaid>}} Renders to:
gantt dateFormat HH-mm axisFormat %M section 1. Step 1 1h :step1, 00-00, 1m section 2. Step 2 2h :step2, after step1, 2m section 3. Step 3 3h :step3, after step2, 3m Flow chart Flow charts are used in chapters to show where in the accelerator you are
{{<mermaid>}} flowchart LR id1(Step 1)-->id2(Step 2)-->id3(Step 3) style id1 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#6638B8,stroke-width:3px style id2 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px style id3 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px {{</mermaid>}} Renders to
flowchart LR id1(Step 1)-->id2(Step 2)-->id3(Step 3) style id1 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#6638B8,stroke-width:3px style id2 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px style id3 fill:#f5f5f5,stroke:#333,stroke-width:1px

title: Shortcodes
content:
Shortcodes allow us to add custom html codeblocks to the accelerator. Examples on this site include:
Notes Tabs Navbar

title: Tabs
content:
Tabs can be handy for providing code snippets for multiple languages or providing configuration in different formats.
{{< tabs groupId="tab_id" >}} {{% tab name="Tab 1" %}} ### Tab 1 {{% /tab %}} {{% tab name="Tab 2" %}} ### Tab 2 {{% /tab %}} {{</tabs >}} Tab 1 Tab 2 Tab 1 Tab 2

title: Attachments
content:
The Attachments shortcode displays a list of files attached to a page. This is useful for providing sample data and notebooks.
The attachments need to be placed in a pages.files folder. For example, if a page is named test_page attachments need to be added to a folder called test_page.files.
{{%attachments style="blue"/%}} renders to
Attachments sample-attachment.txt (27 B)

title: Deploy
content:
To deploy the hugo site, add the attached deploy.yml and save it in a .github/workflows folder.
Attachments deploy.yml (1 KB) Edit the environment variables below to match your acclerator. Once you push to main the accelerator should be available on the gh-pages site.
env: TITLE: YOUR_TITLE_HERE DESCRIPTION: YOUR_DESCRIPTION_HERE BASE_URL: https://docs.snowplow.io/GITHUB-REPO-NAME AUTHOR: AUTHOR LANDING_PAGE_URL: /GITHUB-REPO-NAME
